definition: villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
wolf/CL:匹[pi3],隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
a legendary wolf/distressed/wretched
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
wicked/crafty/traitor/variant of 姦|奸[jian1]
to fornicate/to defile/adultery/rape

sentences.english: They run rampant with spyware and viruses.
sentences.chinese: 他们与间谍软件和病毒狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: Really there is economic brains, yet estimate also together here be one performing in collusion because malign purpose of commander.
sentences.chinese: 的确有经济头脑，但估计也同这里当官的狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: This idiom is used to describe doing evil things in collusion with others.
sentences.chinese: 狼狈为奸这个成语比喻坏人互相勾结起来干坏事。

sentences.english: The reactionaries work hand-in-glove with the imperialists to suppress the national liberation movement.
sentences.chinese: 反动派同帝国主义狼狈为奸，镇压民族解放运动。

sentences.english: Some of the local policemen are in with the criminals.
sentences.chinese: 当地某些警察和罪犯狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: They acted in collusion with corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 他们与贪官污吏狼狈为奸。

sentences.english: They ganged up and acted in collusion with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们拉帮结派，狼狈为奸。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
to act in collusion (idiom)
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to conspire/to plot together
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to conspire/to gang up
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
